cluster_classes.class_description: Components of flowering plants directly involved in sexual reproduction and pollination, including whole flowers and the pollen grains they produce and exchange.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Reproductive structures of plants that provide nectar and pollen… specific reproductive material moved by butterflies among flowers.

cluster_classes.class_description: The biological process in which pollen is transferred between flowers, enabling sexual reproduction in flowering plants, often facilitated by animals such as butterflies.
cluster_classes.class_group: Flowering Plant Reproduction (Plants, Structures, Materials & Processes)
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Pollination transfers pollen between flowers, enabling plant reproduction; plants are the organisms whose reproduction is assisted.

members.entity_description: Biological process in which pollen is transferred between flowers, enabling plant reproduction, often facilitated by animals such as butterflies.

cluster_classes.class_description: Organisms that reproduce via flowers and benefit from pollination, including those whose reproduction is assisted by butterflies.
cluster_classes.class_group: Flowering Plant Reproduction (Plants, Structures, Materials & Processes)
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Pollination transfers pollen between flowers, enabling plant reproduction; plants are the organisms whose reproduction is assisted.

members.entity_description: Organisms that reproduce via flowers and benefit from pollination by butterflies.

cluster_classes.class_description: Flowers as the reproductive structures of plants that provide nectar and pollen and are visited by pollinators such as butterflies.
cluster_classes.class_group: Flowering Plant Reproduction (Plants, Structures, Materials & Processes)
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Reproductive structures of plants that provide nectar and pollen… specific reproductive material moved by butterflies among flowers.

members.entity_description: Reproductive structures of plants that provide nectar and pollen and are visited by butterflies.

cluster_classes.class_description: Pollen grains as the reproductive material of plants that are transferred between flowers during pollination, often by pollinators such as butterflies.
cluster_classes.class_group: Flowering Plant Reproduction (Plants, Structures, Materials & Processes)
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Reproductive structures of plants that provide nectar and pollen… specific reproductive material moved by butterflies among flowers.

members.entity_description: Reproductive plant grains that butterflies transfer between flowers during pollination.

args.new_description: General category for reproductive structures of flowering plants directly involved in sexual reproduction and pollination, including whole flowers and the pollen grains they produce and exchange.
args.justification: Aligns this umbrella structure class with the same high-level reproductive domain as the related organism, process, flower, and pollen classes, and clarifies that it is a more general structural category than the specific Flowers and Pollen classes.

Unifies the class_group label with the other classes in this cluster to consistently represent a single domain: flowering plant reproduction, while keeping this class specifically as the pollination process within that domain.
Sets a consistent class_group shared with the process and structural/material classes, clarifying that this organism class is the biotic participant in the same flowering plant reproduction domain.

Keeps this class focused on flowers as specific reproductive structures while harmonizing its class_group with related plant, process, and pollen classes to reflect a single coherent reproductive system.

Aligns pollen as reproductive material within the same flowering plant reproduction class_group as flowers, plants, and pollination, ensuring that all closely related reproductive components and processes share a common upper-level grouping.
